intro: Torularia humilis proles piasezkii, commonly known as the dwarf torularia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features simple, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
